abstract: Government policies to prop up shares seem to be having their desired impact, even as many Chinese companies remain suspended from trading.
snippet: Government policies to prop up shares seem to be having their desired impact, even as many Chinese companies remain suspended from trading.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — A week of volatility in China’s stock markets ended on a better note than many investors expected, as government policies to prop up shares seemed to have muted some of the panic among sellers.

headline.main: After Week of Turmoil, Chinese Stocks Post Further Gains
